inscription: Lid verso: 石黒宗麿作  藍彩　茶盃 {Ishiguro Munemaro saku, ransai chawan}. Authenticated by Shimizu Uichi, signed: {Uichi shiki}; sealed: {U}
text: As a child, Ishiguro Munemaro was surrounded by his father’s collection of antique Chinese ceramics. After studying Chinese ceramics, he opened his own kiln in Kyoto in 1927 and eventually continued adding to his father’s collection. He perfected the difficult persimmon tenmoku glaze technique and was designated a Living National Treasure by the Japanese government in 1952.
title: Indigo-colored tea bowl
